intro: Chrysaspis barbulata, commonly known as the featherleaf chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it its common name, and it produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. Chrysaspis barbulata is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
